```{r rmarkdown-setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(message = FALSE)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(warning = FALSE)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(dev = "cairo_pdf")
options(knitr.kable.NA = "")
options(kableExtra.latex.load_packages = FALSE)

set_urbn_defaults(style = "print")

state_table <- table1 %>%
  filter(statename == params$parameter1)
country_table <- table1 %>%
  filter(statename == "US") 

is_small <- state_table$small
is_large <- !(is_small)

# apply formats to state_table
state_table[,grep("_mn",colnames(state_table))]<-state_table[,grep("_mn",colnames(state_table))]*100
state_table[,grep("_share",colnames(state_table))]<-state_table[,grep("_share",colnames(state_table))]*100
state_table[,grep("_benefit",colnames(state_table))]<-state_table[,grep("_benefit",colnames(state_table))]*100

# apply formats to country_table
country_table[,grep("_mn",colnames(country_table))]<- country_table[,grep("_mn",colnames(country_table))]*100

#gather state data ending in _mn
state_mn_data <- state_table %>% 
  select(ends_with("_mn")) %>% 
  gather(key="var",value="mn_value")
#join state _tstat data with _mn data 
state_data_with_tstats <- state_table %>% 
  select(ends_with("_tstat")) %>% 
  gather(key="var",value="tstat_value") %>%
  mutate(var = paste(str_sub(var, 1, str_length(var)-6), "_mn", sep="")) %>%
  left_join(state_mn_data, by = c("var"="var"))
#join state _n data with _mn and _tstat data 
state_data_with_n <- state_table %>% 
  select(ends_with("_n")) %>% 
  gather(key="var",value="n_value") %>%
  mutate(var = paste(str_sub(var, 1, str_length(var)-2), "_mn", sep="")) %>%
  left_join(state_data_with_tstats, by = c("var"="var"))
#combine all data for state, join pie labels and language for text
total_state_data_with_labels <- datdict %>%
  select(Variable.Name, Label.for.Figures, Language.for.Text) %>%
  right_join(state_data_with_n, by = c("Variable.Name"="var")) 
total_state_data_with_labels$location <- toString(state_table$statename)

#gather country data ending in _mn
country_mn_data <- country_table %>% 
  select(ends_with("_mn")) %>% 
  gather(key="var",value="mn_value")
#join country _tstat data with _mn data 
country_data_with_tstats <- country_table %>% 
  select(ends_with("_tstat")) %>% 
  gather(key="var",value="tstat_value") %>%
  mutate(var = paste(str_sub(var, 1, str_length(var)-6), "_mn", sep="")) %>%
  left_join(country_mn_data, by = c("var"="var"))
#join country _n data with _mn and _tstat data 
country_data_with_n <- country_table %>% 
  select(ends_with("_n")) %>% 
  gather(key="var",value="n_value") %>%
  mutate(var = paste(str_sub(var, 1, str_length(var)-2), "_mn", sep="")) %>%
  left_join(country_data_with_tstats, by = c("var"="var"))
#combine all data for country, join pie labels and language for text
total_country_data_with_labels <- datdict %>%
  select(Variable.Name, Label.for.Figures, Language.for.Text) %>%
  right_join(country_data_with_n, by = c("Variable.Name"="var")) 
total_country_data_with_labels$location <- 'US'

all_data <- rbind(total_country_data_with_labels, total_state_data_with_labels) %>%
  filter(Variable.Name != "hier_mn")

if(state_table$expansion == 0){
  if (state_table$note == 0) {
    statement1 <- "which did not expand Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act"
  } else if (state_table$note == 1) {
    statement1 <- "which expanded Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act after 2017" 
  } else if (state_table$note == 2) {
    statement1 <- "which has voted to expand but not yet implemented Medicaid expansion under the Affordable Care Act" 
  }
} else{
    statement1 <- "which expanded Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act" 
}

if( state_table$ui_tstat<1.960 | state_table$ui_mn==country_table$ui_mn) {
statement2 <- "comparable"
statement3 <- "to" 
} else if ( state_table$ui_tstat>1.960 & state_table$ui_mn > country_table$ui_mn) {
statement2 <- "higher"
statement3 <- "than"
} else if ( state_table$ui_tstat>1.960 & state_table$ui_mn < country_table$ui_mn) {
statement2 <- "lower"
statement3 <- "than"
} 

statement4_frame <- total_state_data_with_labels %>% 
  filter(mn_value > state_table$ui_mn) %>% 
  filter(tstat_value>=1.960 ) %>%
  filter(n_value>=200) %>%
  select(Language.for.Text, mn_value, tstat_value)
statement4_list <- statement4_frame[["Language.for.Text"]] 
start <- paste(statement4_list[1:length(statement4_list)-1], collapse = ", ")
end <- statement4_list[length(statement4_list)]
if(length(statement4_list) == 1){
  statement4 <- paste0(" ", end)
  statement9 <- "had a higher uninsurance rate than the state average"
} else if (length(statement4_list) == 2){
  statement4 <- paste0(" ", start, " and ", end)
  statement9 <- "had higher uninsurance rates than the state average"
} else {
  statement4 <- paste0(" ", start, ", and ", end)
  statement9 <- "had higher uninsurance rates than the state average"
}

if (state_table$expansion == 1 | state_table$note == 1){
  statement5 <- "further expanding access to Medicaid or other highly subsidized insurance, as well as targeted outreach and enrollment efforts to subgroups of already eligible women with the highest uninsurance rates."
} else{
  statement5 <- "expanding access to Medicaid or other highly subsidized insurance, as well as targeted outreach and enrollment efforts to subgroups of already eligible women with the highest uninsurance rates."
}

if(state_table$ui_n >= 1000000){
  statement7 <- paste(round(state_table$ui_n/1000000, 1), "million", " ")
} else{
  statement7 <- statement7 <- prettyNum(round(state_table$ui_n, -3),big.mark=",",scientific=FALSE)
}

if(state_table$statename == "the District of Columbia"){
  statement8 <- "DC"
} else{
  statement8 <- state_table$statename
}

# Pie chart caption options
pie_caption1<-ifelse(state_table$fpwaiver == 1, "Some uninsured women in all categories may be eligible for or enrolled in a Medcaid plan that covers family planning services only. ","")
pie_caption2<-ifelse(state_table$note == 5|state_table$note == 4, "Some women likely eligible for Marketplace premium assistance may be eligible for more affordable coverage through a state-specific program. ","")

if (state_table$expansion == 1) {
    # expansion states looking ahead text
    lookingahead<-paste("Following Medicaid expansion in ",state_table$statename, ", the uninsurance rate fell from ", format(round(state_table$ui_mn13, 1), nsmall=1) ," percent in 2013 to ", format(round(state_table$ui_mn, 1), nsmall=1), " percent in 2017. Despite coverage gains, approximately ", statement7, " ", state_table$statename," women of reproductive age remained uninsured in 2017.",sep='')
} else {
  # nonexpansion states beginning of looking ahead text
  if (state_table$expansion == 0 & state_table$note == 1) {
    lookingahead_start<-"The recent Medicaid expansion in "
  } else if (state_table$expansion == 0 & state_table$note == 2) {
    lookingahead_start<-"The recent vote to expand Medicaid in "
  } else if (state_table$expansion == 0) {
    lookingahead_start<-"Expanding Medicaid in "
  } 
  # nonexpansion states full xlooking ahead text
  if (state_table$expansion == 0 & state_table$fpwaiver == 1 & state_table$hier_fpw_share>0) {
    lookingahead<-paste(lookingahead_start,state_table$statename," could benefit approximately ", format(round(state_table$hier_benefit, 1),nsmall=1), " percent of uninsured ", state_table$statename, " women of reproductive age, including currently ineligible citizens with incomes below the FPL (",format(round(state_table$hier_fpw_share, 1), nsmall=1), " percent) and those with incomes between 100 and 138 percent of the FPL (",format(round(state_table$hier_100_138_share, 1), nsmall=1)," percent) for whom Medicaid may be more affordable than Marketplace coverage.",sep='')
  } else if (state_table$expansion == 0 & state_table$fpwaiver == 1 & state_table$hier_fpw_share==0) {
    lookingahead<-paste(lookingahead_start,state_table$statename," could benefit approximately ", format(round(state_table$hier_benefit, 1),nsmall=1), " percent of uninsured ", state_table$statename, " women of reproductive age, including those with incomes between 100 and 138 percent of the FPL (",format(round(state_table$hier_100_138_share, 1), nsmall=1)," percent) for whom Medicaid may be more affordable than Marketplace coverage.",sep='')
  }else if (state_table$expansion == 0 & state_table$fpwaiver == 0) {
    lookingahead<-paste(lookingahead_start,state_table$statename," could benefit approximately ", format(round(state_table$hier_benefit, 1),nsmall=1), " percent of uninsured ", state_table$statename, " women of reproductive age, including currently ineligible citizens with incomes below the FPL (",format(round(state_table$hier_pov_none_share, 1), nsmall=1), " percent) and those with incomes between 100 and 138 percent of the FPL (",format(round(state_table$hier_100_138_share, 1), nsmall=1)," percent) for whom Medicaid may be more affordable than Marketplace coverage.",sep='')
  }
}

outreach<-paste0("Outreach and enrollment efforts targeted at subgroups of women with high uninsurance rates and those already eligible for assistance could help reduce the uninsurance rate in ", state_table$statename, ", though higher subsidies may be required to help address affordability barriers. blank_data_for_chart$location = 'US'
```

```{r echo=FALSE}
#Obtain data rows that have sample size below 200 sample size

#overflow for second bullet

  rbind(blank_data_for_chart)
#Factor order for subgroups on plot x axis
plot_order <- c("Not in labor force", "Unemployed", "Employed", "space6","Not in metropolitan area", "In metropolitan area", "space5","Above 400% FPL", "251%â€“400% FPL", "139%â€“250% FPL", "0%â€“138% FPL", "space4", "Single, childless", "Married, childless", "Single mother", "Married mother", "space3", "Other/multiple races", "Hispanic", "Black", "White", "space2", "Ages 35â€“44", "Ages 26â€“34", "Ages 19â€“25", "Ages 15â€“18", "space1", "All women (ages 15â€“44)")
state_for_chart <- ifelse(state_table$statename=="the District of Columbia","DC",as.character(state_table$statename))
#Factor order for location on plot x axis
state_order <- c("US", state_for_chart)
#Generate bar chart
state_plot <- total_data_for_chart %>%
  mutate(location = factor(as.character(location), levels = state_order)) %>%

  ggplot(aes(x=Label.for.Figures, y=mn_value, fill=location)) +

  theme(
  axis.text.y=element_text(size=8.5),
  plot.title = element_blank(),
  axis.title.x = element_blank(),
  axis.title.y = element_blank(),
  axis.line.x=element_blank(),
  axis.line.y = element_line(colour = "black"),
  axis.text.x = element_blank(),
  axis.ticks.x = element_blank(),
  panel.grid.minor.y = element_blank(),
  panel.grid.major.y = element_blank(),
  legend.text = element_text(family="Lato"),
  legend.title=element_blank(),
  legend.direction = "vertical",
  legend.position = c(.85, .975)) +
  scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0,0),
                     limits = c(0,60)) +
  guides(fill = guide_legend(reverse=TRUE)) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("#fdbf11", "#1696d2")) +
  scale_x_discrete(name ="Labels", c("Not in labor force", "Unemployed", "Employed", " ","Not in metropolitan area", "In metropolitan area", " ","Above 400% FPL", "251%â€“400% FPL", "139%â€“250% FPL", "0%â€“138% FPL", " ", "Single, childless", "Married, childless", "Single mother", "Married mother", " ", "Other/multiple races", "Hispanic", "Black", "White", " ", "Ages 35â€“44", "Ages 26â€“34", "Ages 19â€“25", "Ages 15â€“18", " ", "All women (ages 15â€“44)"))+
  coord_flip()
ggsave("state_plot.pdf", plot = state_plot, path = "Plots", scale = 1, width =5, height = 6.5, units = "in", device = cairo_pdf)
```

```{r, fig.width=7.5, fig.height=2.25, fig.fullwidth=TRUE, eval = is_large}
par(lwd = 1)
datdict <- read.csv(file="Tables/State Uninsurance WRA Data Dictionary.csv", header=TRUE, sep=",")
colnames(datdict)[1]<-"Variable.Name"
row.names(datdict)<-datdict$Variable.Name
pie_labels<-datdict[c("hier_pov_none_share", "hier_noncit400pl_share","hier_mktplce_share","hier_medicaid_share","hier_fpw_share"),]["Label.for.Figures"]
pie_labels$var<-row.names(pie_labels)
pie_labs<-pie_labels %>% mutate(lab_for_figs = as.character(Label.for.Figures)) %>% select(var, lab_for_figs)
 #to force the same color for payment type in all figures
type<-factor(levels=c("hier_pov_none_share", "hier_noncit400pl_share","hier_mktplce_share","hier_medicaid_share","hier_fpw_share"))
myColors <- c("#fdbf11","#1696d2","#000000","#ec008b","#d2d2d2")
names(myColors) <- levels(type)
t<-state_table %>% 
  select(hier_pov_none_share, hier_noncit400pl_share,hier_mktplce_share,hier_medicaid_share,hier_fpw_share) %>% 
  gather(key="var",value="value") %>% 
  left_join(pie_labs) %>% 
  filter(value>0)
t$lab_for_figs_brks<-sapply(strwrap(t$lab_for_figs, 35, simplify=FALSE), paste, collapse="\n" )

t2<-t %>% 
  mutate(labels_w_num = paste(lab_for_figs_brks, " \n",format(round(value, 1),nsmall=1), "%", sep =""), 
         value = as.numeric(value),
         label_position = cumsum(value),
         end = 2 * pi * cumsum(value)/sum(value),
         start = lag(end, default = 0),
         middle = 0.5 * (start + end),
         nudgex = ifelse(length(value)==3 & end > pi*1.3 & end-start > 2.5 , -4, #nudge positions to left or right of pie depending on number (length(value)) and size (end-start) of slices
                  ifelse(length(value)==3 & end < pi*1.3, 3.5,
                  ifelse(length(value)==3 & end > pi*1.3, -3.5,
                  ifelse(length(value)==4 & end-start > 0.8 & start < pi*0.90 & end < pi*1.4, 3.5,
                  ifelse(length(value)==4 & end-start < 0.8 & start > pi*0.90 & end < pi*1.4, -3.5,
                  ifelse(length(value)==4 & end > pi*1.4, -3.5,
                  ifelse(length(value)==4 & end < pi, 3.5,-3.5))))))),
         nudgey = ifelse(middle < pi/2 | middle > pi*1.1, -0.25, 0.25),
         hjust = ifelse(middle > pi, 1, 0),
         vjust = ifelse(middle < pi/2 | middle > 3 * pi/2, 0, 1))
par(mar=rep(0,4))
 ggplot(t2) + 
  geom_arc_bar(aes(x0 = 0, y0 = 0, r0 = 0, r = 1,
                   start = start, end = end, fill = var),color = "white") +
  geom_text_repel(mapping = aes(x = 1.05 * sin(middle),
                y = 1.05 * cos(middle),
                label = labels_w_num,
                hjust = hjust,
                vjust = vjust),
  size = 2.6,
  nudge_x = t2$nudgex,
  nudge_y = t2$nudgey,
  segment.color = "black", 
  segment.size=0.35) +
  scale_fill_manual(values=myColors) +
  coord_fixed() +
  scale_x_continuous(limits = c(-4,4),  # Adjust so labels are not cut off
                     name = "", breaks = NULL, labels = NULL) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(-1.25,1.25),      # Adjust so labels are not cut off
                     name = "", breaks = NULL, labels = NULL)+
  remove_ticks() +
  remove_axis() + 
  theme(legend.position = "none") 
```
